abstracts.cdata!:
The Third Education Project for
            Afghanistan, approved in 1979, had been effective for only a
            few months when all withdrawals by the Borrower were
            suspended in 1980. The reason of the cancellation the
            Borrower requested a shift in Technical Assistance (TA)
            support from the Credit to grant assistance available from
            United Nations Development Program and Indian Technical
            Assistance programs. The country situation from 1980 on
            curtailed all implementation activities and the project
            cannot be rated. When a Borrower is faced with budgetary
            constraints, it is more likely to seek grants to finance TA
            than to use Credit funds. This can lead to delays in
            implementation of TA and to management and coordination problems.

abstracts.cdata!:
The principal objective of the project
            is to expand primary education on a regional basis, and
            improve its quality through primary teacher training and
            curricula reform. Another objective is to strengthen the
            planning and administrative capacities of the Ministries of
            Education and Higher Education. The project would include:
            (a) new primary teacher training institutes (partly in
            replacement of existing inadequate facilities); (b) special
            provisions to attract women trainees; (c) an academy to
            train teacher trainers, administrators and planners; (d)
            curricula reform to make the education system more community
            and development-oriented; (e) demonstration schools; and (f)
            related technical assistance. Incremental annual output from
            the project institutions is estimated at about 1400
            teachers, and about 275 trainers, administrators and
            planners. In addition, the upgraded replacement facilities
            would produce some 1200 teachers and some 25 trainers annually.
